<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 322, 390, 336]]<|/det|>
# READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 352, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 329, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 497, 415]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 601, 431]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 285, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 907, 493]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 494, 589, 508]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 509, 606, 524]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 556, 756, 571]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 572, 440, 586]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 907, 618]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 865, 729, 880]]<|/det|>
This document consists of 3 printed pages and 1 blank page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 99, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 290, 109]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \left(x^{3} + \frac{1}{x^{3}}\right)\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 144, 97, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 144, 608, 163]]<|/det|>
(i) Find the terms in \(x^{2}\) and \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \(\left(1 - \frac{3}{2} x\right)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 180, 153, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 178, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
Given that there is no term in \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((k + 2x)\big(1 - \frac{3}{2} x\big)^{6}\), find the value of the constant \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 920, 216]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 241, 94, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 241, 740, 260]]<|/det|>
The equation \(x^{2} + px + q = 0\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants, has roots \(-3\) and \(5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 273, 153, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 373, 291]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 273, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 304, 153, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
Using these values of \(p\) and \(q\), find the value of the constant \(r\) for which the equation \(x^{2} + px + q + r = 0\) has equal roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 319, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 370, 94, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 665, 395]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{4}{3x - 4}\) and \(P(2, 2)\) is a point on the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 408, 153, 426]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 408, 556, 426]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 408, 920, 426]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 438, 153, 456]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 437, 589, 456]]<|/det|>
Find the angle that this tangent makes with the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 438, 920, 456]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 490, 94, 510]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 484, 153, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 484, 520, 515]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity \(\frac{\cos \theta}{\tan \theta (1 - \sin \theta)} \equiv 1 + \frac{1}{\sin \theta}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 535, 153, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 533, 672, 562]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\cos \theta}{\tan \theta (1 - \sin \theta)} = 4\), for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 600, 96, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 593, 578, 621]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}:x\mapsto \frac{x + 3}{2x - 1}\), \(x\in \mathbb{R}\), \(x\neq \frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 635, 153, 653]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 635, 319, 653]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathrm{ff}(x) = x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 635, 920, 653]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 666, 153, 684]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 666, 581, 684]]<|/det|>
Hence, or otherwise, obtain an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 666, 920, 684]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 712, 96, 730]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 712, 920, 746]]<|/det|>
The line \(L_{1}\) passes through the points \(A\) (2, 5) and \(B\) (10, 9). The line \(L_{2}\) is parallel to \(L_{1}\) and passes through the origin. The point \(C\) lies on \(L_{2}\) such that \(AC\) is perpendicular to \(L_{2}\). Find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 752, 153, 771]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 752, 329, 771]]<|/det|>
the coordinates of \(C\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 752, 920, 771]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 778, 151, 796]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 778, 292, 796]]<|/det|>
the distance \(AC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 778, 920, 796]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 776, 94]]<|/det|>
Relative to the origin \(O\), the position vectors of the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 97, 705, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 5 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \overrightarrow{OB} = \begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \quad \text{and} \quad \overrightarrow{OC} = \begin{pmatrix} 10 \\ 0 \\ 6 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 160, 151, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 160, 295, 178]]<|/det|>
Find angle \(ABC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 160, 920, 178]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 187, 526, 207]]<|/det|>
The point \(D\) is such that \(ABCD\) is a parallelogram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 217, 153, 234]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 217, 395, 234]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 217, 920, 234]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 259, 96, 277]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 259, 767, 277]]<|/det|>
The function f is such that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 3 - 4\cos^{k}x\), for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \pi\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 288, 153, 306]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 288, 351, 306]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(k = 2\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 185, 329]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 312, 348, 329]]<|/det|>
find the range of f,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 312, 920, 329]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 336, 188, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 336, 581, 354]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 336, 920, 354]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 363, 151, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 363, 351, 381]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(k = 1\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 388, 185, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 388, 425, 406]]<|/det|>
sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 388, 920, 406]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 412, 185, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 412, 559, 429]]<|/det|>
state, with a reason, whether f has an inverse.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 453, 104, 472]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 453, 144, 472]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 453, 920, 503]]<|/det|>
A circle is divided into 6 sectors in such a way that the angles of the sectors are in arithmetic progression. The angle of the largest sector is 4 times the angle of the smallest sector. Given that the radius of the circle is \(5 \mathrm{cm}\), find the perimeter of the smallest sector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 488, 920, 505]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 514, 146, 532]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 514, 920, 547]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 553, 190, 571]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 553, 415, 571]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 820, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
